before_flood.title: Purchase flood insurance
before_flood.description: Contact your insurance provider to obtain flood coverage to protect your property from potential flood damage.

before_flood.title: Prepare an emergency kit
before_flood.description: Compile a kit with essential supplies including water, food, medication, flashlight, batteries, and first aid supplies to last at least 72 hours.

before_flood.title: Create a family communication plan
before_flood.description: Establish a plan to ensure all family members know how to reach one another and where to meet in case of evacuation.

before_flood.title: Know your evacuation routes
before_flood.description: Familiarize yourself with multiple evacuation routes from your neighborhood to avoid congestion during an emergency.

before_flood.title: Stay informed about flood risks
before_flood.description: Regularly check weather reports and local alerts regarding Mosquito Creek's flood potential and any warnings issued by local authorities.

before_flood.title: Elevate electrical appliances
before_flood.description: Raise electrical appliances and utilities above potential flood levels to prevent damage during flooding.

before_flood.title: Secure hazardous materials
before_flood.description: Identify and secure hazardous materials around your home that could cause additional harm during flooding, such as chemicals and fuels.

before_flood.title: Plan for pets
before_flood.description: Include your pets in your emergency plan and ensure you have supplies for their care during an evacuation.

before_flood.title: Store important documents safely
before_flood.description: Keep important documents (insurance, ID, medical records) in a waterproof container or a safe place to ensure they are not lost during flooding.

before_flood.title: Identify local evacuation routes
before_flood.description: Familiarize yourself with the safest routes out of your neighborhood in the event of a flood, including routes to local emergency shelters.

before_flood.title: Conduct home flood-proofing
before_flood.description: Elevate appliances and electrical systems above flood construction levels (FCLs) and install barriers to redirect floodwaters.

before_flood.title: Review floodplain maps
before_flood.description: Consult the latest floodplain maps available from the City of Vancouver to understand the flood risk associated with your property.

before_flood.title: Regularly clear drainage systems
before_flood.description: Ensure that gutters and drainage systems are clear of debris to facilitate proper water runoff and reduce flooding risks.

before_flood.title: Maintain contact with local emergency services
before_flood.description: Keep updated contact information for local emergency services, shelters, and community resource centers for flood events.

before_flood.title: Learn evacuation procedures
before_flood.description: Familiarize yourself with local emergency evacuation routes and procedures specific to Vancouver, particularly in flood-prone areas.

before_flood.title: Practice utility shutoff
before_flood.description: Learn how to properly shut off gas, water, and electricity in your home to prevent hazards during a flood event.

before_flood.title: Document your property condition
before_flood.description: Take photos and videos of your property, including valuables, to document their condition for insurance claims in the event of flood damage.

before_flood.title: Stay informed about local weather
before_flood.description: Regularly check weather forecasts and alerts for flood warnings in the Vancouver area, especially during the rainy season.

before_flood.title: Utilize flood resilience resources
before_flood.description: Engage with flood resilience programs offered by local organizations to better understand risks and mitigation strategies in the Vancouver area.

before_flood.title: Elevate critical utilities and appliances
before_flood.description: Position major appliances and critical utilities (e.g., furnace, electrical panel) above the flood construction level to minimize damage.

before_flood.title: Maintain drainage systems
before_flood.description: Regularly inspect and clean gutters, downspouts, and drainage systems to ensure they can adequately handle heavy rainfall.

before_flood.title: Know emergency shelters
before_flood.description: Identify local emergency shelters in Vancouver where you and your family can go during a flooding emergency.

before_flood.title: Monitor community alerts
before_flood.description: Sign up for community alerts and notifications regarding flooding and emergency services in the Vancouver area.

before_flood.title: Follow local agency guidelines
before_flood.description: Stay updated with flood preparedness guidelines provided by Metro Vancouver and other local agencies to ensure compliance with safety measures.

before_flood.title: Elevate electrical systems and utilities
before_flood.description: Ensure that electrical systems, heating systems, and utilities are elevated above the flood construction level as per local guidelines.

before_flood.title: Monitor weather forecasts
before_flood.description: Keep an eye on weather forecasts and flood warnings from local news and the Environment Canada website.

before_flood.title: Identify safe locations
before_flood.description: Determine safer locations, including local community centers and schools, that can serve as shelters during a flood.

before_flood.title: Prepare your vehicle
before_flood.description: Ensure that your vehicle is in working condition, filled with gas, and equipped with emergency supplies in case of evacuation.

before_flood.title: Prepare an emergency plan
before_flood.description: Create a comprehensive emergency plan that includes emergency meeting places, communication methods, and important contacts. Update it annually.

before_flood.title: Make grab-and-go bags
before_flood.description: Pack bags with essential items like water, food, first aid kits, and personal documents. Store them in an easily accessible location.

before_flood.title: Store valuables in elevated locations
before_flood.description: Place important documents and valuables in waterproof containers or elevated areas to protect them from potential flood damage.

before_flood.title: Clear gutters and drains
before_flood.description: Regularly clean gutters and ensure storm drains are clear of debris to help prevent water accumulation and potential flooding.

before_flood.title: Install flood-proofing measures
before_flood.description: Enhance your home with flood-resistant doors, backflow valves, and sump pumps to reduce flood risk.

before_flood.title: Monitor local emergency information
before_flood.description: Know where to find important alerts through local authorities, websites, and social media to stay updated during a flooding event.

during_flood.title: Monitor local flood alerts
during_flood.description: Subscribe to local alerts from the District of North Vancouver for updates on flood warnings and emergency instructions.

during_flood.title: Follow evacuation procedures
during_flood.description: If instructed by local authorities, evacuate immediately using the designated routes to ensure safety during flood conditions.

during_flood.title: Shut off utilities
during_flood.description: Turn off gas, electricity, and water before evacuation to prevent hazards such as gas leaks or electrical fires.

during_flood.title: Stay tuned to emergency updates
during_flood.description: Use battery-powered radios or mobile devices to stay informed about the flood situation and instructions from emergency services.

during_flood.title: Shut off utilities before evacuation
during_flood.description: Prior to evacuating, shut off gas, power, and water services to prevent further hazards from flooding.

during_flood.title: Evacuate to higher ground
during_flood.description: Follow pre-planned evacuation routes to move to designated shelters or higher ground away from flood risk areas.

during_flood.title: Stay informed via local alerts
during_flood.description: Monitor local news reports and emergency alerts for real-time information on flooding and safety measures.

during_flood.title: Evacuate promptly if instructed
during_flood.description: If local authorities issue evacuation orders, evacuate immediately following the prescribed routes to ensure safety.

during_flood.title: Keep emergency kit accessible
during_flood.description: Ensure your emergency kit is easily accessible during a flooding event, ready for quick use if evacuation is necessary.

during_flood.title: Stay tuned to local media
during_flood.description: Listen to local news and weather advisories to stay informed about the status of the flood and further emergency instructions.

during_flood.title: Turn off utilities if flooded
during_flood.description: Know how to safely turn off gas, electricity, and water at the main shutoff points in your home before evacuating.

during_flood.title: Follow evacuation orders
during_flood.description: Heed all evacuation orders from local authorities promptly to ensure your safety and the safety of your family.

during_flood.title: Stay informed during a flood event
during_flood.description: Continue to monitor emergency services' updates regarding flood conditions and safety instructions via radio or mobile apps.

during_flood.title: Avoid flooded areas
during_flood.description: Do not attempt to walk, swim, or drive through floodwaters, as they may be deeper or moving faster than they appear.

during_flood.title: Stay informed during the flood
during_flood.description: Monitor local news and authorities for updates regarding the status of the flood and any necessary actions to take.

after_flood.title: Document flood damage
after_flood.description: Take photos or videos of any damage to your property immediately after the flood for insurance claims and recovery purposes.

after_flood.title: Contact your insurance for claims
after_flood.description: After ensuring safety, contact your insurance provider to file claims for flood damage as soon as possible.

after_flood.title: Begin cleanup process
after_flood.description: Start the cleanup process as soon as it is safe, removing water-damaged items and beginning repairs to prevent further damage.

after_flood.title: Seek local resources for assistance
after_flood.description: Connect with local agencies and community groups in Vancouver that offer assistance and resources for flood recovery.

after_flood.title: Document damage after flooding
after_flood.description: Take photographs and notes of any damage to your property for insurance claims and recovery assistance applications.

after_flood.title: Clean up safely
after_flood.description: Ensure that you wear protective gear while cleaning up flood debris and contact local waste management for disposal guidance.

after_flood.title: Seek recovery assistance
after_flood.description: Investigate available local resources and assistance programs for flood recovery, including financial aid or restoration support.

after_flood.title: Return only when safe
after_flood.description: After the flood, do not return home until officials declare it safe to do so, as unseen hazards may still be present.

after_flood.title: Document flood damages
after_flood.description: Take photographs and make lists of all damages for insurance claims and recovery assistance.

after_flood.title: Begin cleanup safely
after_flood.description: Wear protective gear and handle cleanup with caution, ensuring that any hazardous materials or electrical issues are dealt with by professionals.

after_flood.title: Document damages post-flood
after_flood.description: After the flood, take detailed photographs of any damage to your home and belongings for insurance claims.

after_flood.title: Contact your insurance company
after_flood.description: Report any flooding damages to your insurance provider as soon as possible to initiate the claims process.

after_flood.title: Seek community support services
after_flood.description: Reach out to local organizations and agencies that can provide assistance and resources for recovery and rebuilding.

after_flood.title: Document damage post-flood
after_flood.description: Take photos and keep records of any flood-related damage to your property for insurance claims and recovery processes.

after_flood.title: Evaluate and update your emergency plan
after_flood.description: After experiencing a flood, review what worked and what didnâ€™t in your emergency plan, and make necessary adjustments.

after_flood.title: Contact local aid organizations
after_flood.description: Reach out to local agencies or charities for assistance if you need help with recovery or finding resources after a flood.

accuracy.justification: Most sources cited are from official documents and local government websites, indicating a high level of reliability. However, some sources may not be directly related to flood preparedness, which slightly lowers the score.

clarity.justification: The language used is generally clear and easy to understand, with minimal technical jargon. However, a few phrases could be simplified further for better comprehension.

completeness.justification: The plan covers all essential preparedness categories, including communication, evacuation, property protection, insurance, family planning, and emergency kits.

relevance.justification: The guidance is tailored specifically to Vancouver, BC, with references to local flood risks and resources, making it highly relevant to the area.

coherence.justification: The guidance flows logically from before to during to after a flood, with a clear structure. However, there are some minor redundancies in actions that could be streamlined for better clarity.
